metadata.Title: CVE-2022-0185 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - high
metadata.Description:
A heap-based buffer overflow flaw was found in the way thelegacy_parse_param function in the Filesystem Context functionality of theLinux kernel verified the supplied parameters length. An unprivileged (incase of unprivileged user namespaces enabled, otherwise needs namespacedCAP_SYS_ADMIN privilege) local user able to open a filesystem that does notsupport the Filesystem Context API (and thus fallbacks to legacy handling)could use this flaw to escalate their privileges on the system.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-0185` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-214-generic - 4.13.0-16.19
linux-image-4.15.0-214-generic-lpae - 4.13.0-16.19
linux-image-4.15.0-214-lowlatency - 4.13.0-16.19
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-214-generic - 4.13.0-16.19
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-214-lowlatency - 4.13.0-16.19
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-5.4.0-152-generic - 5.4.0-96.109~18.04.1

criterions.comment: linux package in esm-infra/bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.13.0-16.19').
linux-hwe: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'replaced by linux-hwe-5.4').
